classification: Beadwork; Tools, Equipment and Utilitarian Objects
creditline: Gift of funds from the N. Bud and Beverly Grossman Foundation in honor of Dr. Evan M. Maurer, Director Emeritus, for his visionary leadership of The Minneapolis Institute of Arts, 1988-2005
description: lower section is rawhide triangle, split at top to near bottom, with hole at bottom; decorated with triangles and blocks in red, blue, green and yellow; top section of tan cloth with hanging loop and padded top section; two straps of linear beadwork in red, blue and yellow
dimension: 40 1/8 x 12 3/16 x 2 1/2 in. (101.92 x 30.96 x 6.35 cm) (including top loop)
title: Horse Crupper
